basics.name: Austin J. Hardy
basics.title: Senior Systems Engineer
basics.summary: Ut prosim. Ready for any challenge or opportunity from over 15 years in Enterprise IT.

work.name: Netflix, Inc.
highlights: Ad Ops pipeline - Developed a custom Jira project and automation rules for the Ad Operations team, enabling streamlined ad campaign management and work tracking. This included custom fields, workflows, and dashboards to enhance visibility and reporting of over $30M in revenue.

Jira Cloud Mail Handler (JCMH) - Scaled a custom plugin to handle external email intake, replies, comments, and attachments across many federated Jira sites, streamlining organization-wide communication.
Data-Driven Decisions - Built Global Agile Dashboards using Atlassian Analytics and SQL, enabling actionable insights for thousands of Workforce Engineering users.
M&A Migrations - Developed scalable Python scripts for replicating user identity access (AuthZ) during Atlassian migrations to a central Atlassian Cloud Org

Cloud SRE - Managed incidents and operational alerts and response runbooks, ensuring reliability with Atlassian tools and support. I disabled hundreds of unused webhooks and cleaned up resource-heavy legacy automation rules.
Jira Custom Plugins - Enhanced feature and operational support for JCMH and the Atlassian API Proxy, a mutual TLS authorization app for secure and seamless integrations of development systems.
Project Godzilla - Led Atlassian Data Center to Cloud migration for over 5000 external partners, ensuring operational continuity.
Games Work Translation - Implemented multi-language work translation in Jira for Netflix Games, improving global bug and issue tracking.
work.summary: As a Senior Systems Engineer at Netflix, I streamline operations and automation within the Atlassian ecosystem, reducing manual efforts and enhancing efficiency for engineering and operations teams. I oversee incident management, drive cloud transitions, and deliver data-driven dashboards to empower strategic decision-making. By building knowledge bases, enabling integrations, and providing targeted support for major organizational transitions, I ensure that tools and processes align seamlessly with Netflix's dynamic needs.

work.name: Coinbase Global Inc.
highlights: Product Launch Calendar - Transformed cross-functional approval & rollout process for tracking features, releases, and programs, benefiting millions of global customers.
Rolling Intake - Streamlined IT Program Management with automated Insights self-service, enhancing efficiency for dynamic datasets.
MNPI Issue Level Security - Automated Restricted issue access for MNPI compliance across the organization.
WEB3 Demo to IT - Immersed in web3, completed Crypto-U courses, and served as COINbassador.
AUDIT-omation - Automated SOC & R+D Expense artifact gathering in Jira, supporting $400M+ in refunds and time savings for tax and audit needs.
work.summary: As a System Engineer on the IT Operations Atlassian team, I oversee the Atlassian Suite, integrating Confluence, Jira, and Jira Service Management, along with Third-Party integrations. I've upgraded systems and plugins, ensuring tool currency and site reliability. Seamlessly integrating solutions across teams, I manage user access, drive agile automation, and troubleshoot effectively. Dedicated to scaling, cost-saving, and inventive collaboration, I collaborate with teams for dependable support and clear communication while maintaining meticulous documentation.

work.name: Blackboard, Inc.
highlights: SRE for Atlassian Server and Datacenter apps, supporting teams and CI/CD pipelines
Managed Third Party SaaS apps, assessed toolset for Security, Accessibility (AX), User Experience (UX), and Product Experience (PX)
Executed Atlassian Cloud migration strategy with Platinum partner
Collaborated with vendors for security and accessibility features
Removed technical debt: legacy integrations, unused licenses, 200 old projects
Decommissioned VMs, promoted AWS usage, eliminated toil and blockers
Led Jira SAFe transformation, integrated Jira Align across PDD programs
Standardized schemes for 100+ active projects' fields, permissions, workflows
Enforced best practices and policies through configuration, automation, and behaviors
Created self-help pages, Slack channels for best practices and features
Coordinated SAML, SCIM, Azure AD changes for improved authentication
Deployed self-service Jira AIO add-on, enabling Power BI reports via AWS
Served as Scrum Master, facilitating Agile activities, sprint metrics, and roadmap plans
work.summary: As Senior System Admin for the Shared Services Tools Team, I managed critical apps and VM systems for Product Development and Delivery teams, handling user authorization, integration configuration, and toolset support. I ensured acceptance criteria aligned with security, architecture, and accessibility goals. Led Agile transformation and reduced technical debt. Implemented improvements and drove collaboration.

work.name: MAXIMUS sub. Omni
highlights: Managed Middleware, SecOps, Help Desk, Auth, TFA, TLS, SLA, DevOps tools
Supported primary app with 4,000 users 24/7/365
Standardized change management processes and environment procedures
Coordinated DBA and System admin cleanup efforts for continuous improvement
Improved legacy systems including Symantec TFA, TLS 1.2, and compliance
Managed Help Desk app, database, client reporting, SSIS coordination
Subject Matter Expert, collaborated across teams for DevOps and tools
Developed new apps, fulfilled automation needs, upgraded legacy tools
work.summary: Managed the Middleware group at the Dept of Education Debt Management System, supporting 4,000 users 24/7/365. Led standardization, system improvements, and compliance efforts. Supported Help Desk, client reporting, and collaborated on cross-team initiatives. Developed new applications and enhanced toolsets for team efficiency and excellence.

work.name: MAXIMUS sub. Omni
highlights: ProdOps/24/7/ETL, Help Desk Admin, SOP/SLAs, Triage, SysAid, ReportsDB, SQL, SSMS, SSIS, HTML
work.summary:
As a Production Control Specialist (SME) and Help Desk Supervising Administrator (HDSA), I provided 24/7/365/99.999% support and site reliability engineering for our primary application, Debt Manager. In addition to normal production activities, I provided full development support to the Help Desk Operations team, including the design, testing, and implementation of new features and settings in a production environment.

Production Control support and subject matter expert for the DMCS Production Operations team, overseeing the operations of DBAs, Application, and System Administrators, as well as monitoring the ETLs executing within the FICO Debt Management system. I even helped repair the reports database DSV & SMDL mappings for client reporting.

work.name: Xerox sub. Omni
highlights: ProdOps/24/7/ETL, JBOSS, SLAs, Reporting, Contract Transition
work.summary: Facilitated Production Control support and served as subject matter expert for the DMCS Production Operations team, overseeing the operations of DBAs, Application, and System Administrators for DMCS, as well as monitoring the ETLs executing within the financial application. I worked to document and transition the contract procedures and policies to ensure a smooth transition to the next contract as an SME.

work.name: OmniSystems, Inc.
highlights: Worked on the DMCS contract as a subcontractor, Consulted on internal projects and new business
work.summary: Acted as a key resource for Executive staff to use for IT projects and assignments. My responsibilities ranged from configuring an office WiFi-DMZ to initializing an internal Help Desk to centralize all IT SOP knowledge bases. I maintained the server room, including organizing equipment, analyzing power efficiency and usage reduction, and documenting the server room layout in Visio format. No task was too large or too small.

work.name: OmniSystems, Inc.
highlights: USVI: EDA Marketplace, Superior Court, Police Dept, Fire Services, WAPA, WICO, UVI.edu
Taught a former Lieutenant General to use iCloud, saved clients' wedding photos, and held executives accountable for insecure devices
work.summary: Acted as a key resource for Executive staff to use for IT projects and assignments. My responsibilities ranged from configuring an office WiFi-DMZ to initializing an internal Help Desk to centralize all our IT processes. I maintained the server room, including organizing equipment and improving power and airflow efficiency, as well as providing an analysis recommending system usage reduction, stratified by a documented layout of the server room in Visio format.

work.name: REAC-TAC Dept of HUD - sub:TomSawyerLLC
highlights: Housing and Urban Development
Remedy
Phone Support
Technical Training
work.summary: As Tier 1+ Help Desk Support, I trained call center staff and modified systems we used. My primary responsibilities included answering customer calls and providing remediation, ranging from password resets to data entry and status updates. This included further escalation to Tier 2 support teams for collaborative resolution.

work.name: REAC-TAC Dept of HUD - sub:CCSI
highlights: HUD, Remedy, Support
work.summary: Performed any assigned duties as a first tier Help Desk Support. My responsibilities included answering customer calls and providing remediation, ranging from password resets to data entry and status updates, as well as further escalation to Tier 2 support teams.
